net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal

Class MessageDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.PriorityContainer
        • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Interface
          • net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal.AbstractModalDialog
            • net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal.MessageDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container<Element>, Element, Focusable

    public class MessageDialog
extends AbstractModalDialog
    A very simple dialog. It presents some text message within its interface, and offers a single button so that the user may confirm that they've seen the message. The text is placed at the top left of the interface and will line wrap. The button will appear below the text.

    • Field Detail

      • INSET

        private static final int INSET
        Gap between the edge of this interface and the text area
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • buttonCallback

        private java.util.Optional<java.lang.Runnable> buttonCallback
        A method that will be notified when the 'okay' button is pressed. No return value, parameters, or exceptions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageDialog

        public MessageDialog(java.lang.String message,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Minimal constructor. The message and location are given, as well as the dimensions of the interface. The button will always be placed at the bottom, regardless of the amount of text.
        Parameters:
        message - The message
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Width of the interface. Text will wrap based on this width
        height - Height of the interface.

    • Method Detail

      • setConfirmListener

        public void setConfirmListener(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Provide a listener to this dialog that will be informed when the 'okay' button is pressed. There are no return values or parameters, so a Runnable is fitting. Null may be provided to remove an existing listener
        Parameters:
        listener - Action to take when the 'okay' button is clicked

      • buttonAction

        private void buttonAction(Button b)
        When the button is clicked, this is called. It'll relay the action to whoever is listening outside of this dialog. Functional programming is so cool!
        Parameters:
        b - The button that was clicked
